title: Best women’s bib shorts: A buyer’s guide to the best bibs for cycling
content:
Cyclist
Best women’s bib shorts: A buyer’s guide to the best bibs for cycling

Whether you’re an avid cyclist or a fair weather rider, having a reliable set of cycling bib shorts is key for comfortable time on the bike. Bib shorts should offer comfort in the saddle with a padded chamois, a flexible waistband which doesn’t inhibit breathing, a secure fit, and be made of a sweat-wicking material which also keeps the sun out.

Some people prefer shorts without straps, as this avoids the need for a comfort break feature, but the lack of straps can cause issues with the shorts not staying securely in place. As such, all the shorts in our guide have bib straps.

The market is abundant with women’s bib shorts so to help you make your decision, the review team at Cyclist has tried and tested many bib shorts and put together this list of the current best bib shorts available now.

Keep reading for full details of these bib shorts plus in-depth buying advice.

Best women’s bib shorts 2023

  1. Castelli Unlimited cargo bib shorts: RRP £135 – Buy Now from Wheelbase (£132.99)
  2. Petrichor Projects women’s bib shorts: RRP £149 – Buy Now from Petrichor (£149)
  3. Albion ABR1 pocket bib shorts: RRP £145 – Buy Now from Albion (£145)
  4. Rapha Women’s Cargo Bib Shorts: RRP £240 – Buy Now from Rapha (£240)
  5. Endura women’s GV500 Reiver bib shorts: RRP £139.99 – Buy now from Wiggle (£111.99)
  6. 7mesh WK3 Cargo Bib Shorts: RRP £200 – Buy now from 7mesh (£170)
  7. Pactimo Women’s Summit Classic Bib Shorts: RRP £180 – Buy Now from Pactimo (£180)
  8. Assos UMA GTV Bib Shorts C2: RRP £215 – Buy Now from Wiggle (£215)
  9. Le Col Sport Cargo Bib Shorts: RRP £155 – Buy Now from Le Col (£77.50)
  10. Maap Women’s Pro Bib Shorts 2.0: RRP £260 – Buy Now from Maap (£260)
  11. Universal Colours Mono women’s Bib Shorts: RRP £125 – Buy Now from Sigma (£65)

Why should you trust us?

We’re cyclists who know and love cycling kit. We hit the road, the trails, we commute by bike and we enjoy chilled leisure rides too. And that’s how we test products: out riding.

We have reviewed the good, the bad and the ugly so we know what works and what should get the boot when it comes to cycling clothing.

Whether it’s the more premium end of the market or the more purse-friendly options, we’ve cast a critical eye over each and every pair of bib tights we reviewed.

With all this in mind, Cyclist has sorted through the market’s current offering and put together the best of the best, with something for every budget, arranged in alphabetical order.

Best women’s bib shorts 2023 reviewed

1. Castelli Unlimited cargo bib shorts

£132.99 (RRP £135) | View offer

Highlights: Great break feature on women’s version, Pockets, Quality chamois, Price
Sizes available: XS – XL Colours available: Black, Gunmetal grey

The Castelli Unlimited cargo bib shorts are one of favourite warm-weather cycling bottoms, with both pockets and an impressive comfort break feature. The cross strap design is highly elasticated and pulls down easily, while the overall fit is high waisted and very comfortable.

The cargo pockets provide easy-access storage and the bib shorts also have a thick long distance-focussed chamois. Though designed for gravel/adventure riding, these are our go-to bib shorts for any riding over an hour.

  • Read our full Castelli Unlimited cargo bib shorts review

2. Petrichor Projects women’s bib shorts

£149 | View offer

Highlights: Clever comfort break design, Pocket, Comfortable chamois, Smooth, flattering fabric
Sizes available: XXS – XXXL Colours available: Black

The Petrichor Projects bib shorts are up there with the Castellis for comfort, though functionally are quite differently. There is a comfort break feature that uses a magnetic clasp on one of the straps, which detaches to allow the rear panel to be dropped. The strap has an added loop which allows you to locate and reconnect it easily.

They also have a pocket on the right leg, as well as an excellent chamois. Bonus points for being a woman-owned independent brand.

  • Buy now from Petrichor Projects
  • Read our full Petrichor Projects women’s bib shorts review

3. Albion ABR1 pocket bib shorts

£145 | View offer

Highlights: Comfortable cut, Highly stretchy, Effective comfort break design, Great pockets
Sizes available: XS – XL Colours available: Black

The Albion ABR1 bib shorts are fully designed for long-distance riding, with a rear pocket for storing jackets or layers and two side pockets for on-the-go essentials. The fabric is incredibly soft on the skin and highly stretchy, great for spending multiple hours on and around the bike.

The bib straps are wide and secure and the lower panel stretches effectively to provide a simple yet effective comfort break feature. They are also made largely from recycled materials, which is a plus.

  • Read our full Albion ABR1 pocket bib shorts review

4. Rapha Women’s Cargo Bib Shorts

£240 | View offer

RRP: £240
Highlights: Sturdy cargo pockets, Breathable upper, Compressive lower fabric
Sizes available: XXS – XL Colours available: Black, blue, green

The Rapha Women’s Cargo bib shorts are a practical, well-thought-out pair of bibs which are ideal for anyone who wants a bit of extra storage while riding. The chamois is lightweight and perforated, for comfort over long distances in hot weather, and the main body features quick-drying fabrics with a compressive fit.

The cargo mesh pockets steal the show with their security and design, and the only missing element is a comfort break feature in the main body of the bib shorts.

  • Read our Rapha Women’s Cargo Bib Shorts review
  • Buy now from Rapha

5. Endura women’s GV500 Reiver bib shorts

£111.99 (RRP £139.99) | View offer

Highlights: Excellent comfort break feature, Supportive chamois, Pockets, Soft fabric
Sizes available: XS – XL Colours available: Black

The Endura GV500 bib shorts feature one of our favourite comfort break features. The design cleverly uses straps that connect at the upper back which split again to allow and rejoin by overlapping at the lower back. This is great because it stops the straps sliding on the shoulders – without the need for a cross strap design – and still holds the fabric secure when the feature is not in use.

The chamois is high density and provides effective support on long rides, and there are leg pockets for storage – worth noting that these sit on the front of the leg rather than the traditional side placement. The GV500 bib shorts do run pretty small so we’d recommend sizing up at least one size.

  • Read our full Endura women’s GV500 Reiver bib shorts review

6. 7mesh WK3 cargo bib shorts

£170 (RRP £200) | View offer

Highlights: Pockets, Comfort break feature, High quality, Good length
Sizes available: XS – XL Colours available: Black, midnight blue, peat

The 7mesh WK3 cargo bib shorts are a high-quality pair of shorts with a good comfort break feature. They have four pockets, two on the legs and two on the lower back, which have ample space for taking even the largest of smartphones.

The WK3 cargo bibs feature square, side-positioned straps in a drop-tail layout which acts as a comfort break feature. The bib shorts use 7mesh women’s performance space chamois, with increased foam density, and is comfortable and breathable. Overall, they are great pair of well-designed shorts which feel good against skin.

  • Read our 7mesh WK3 cargo bib shorts review
  • Buy now from 7mesh

7. Pactimo Women’s Summit Classic Bib Shorts 

£180 | View offer

Highlights: Comfortable, lightweight, comfort break feature
Sizes available: XS – XL Colours available: Black

The Pactimo Summit bib shorts are a great pair of lightweight shorts with a useful comfort break feature and very comfortable chamois, making them ideal for long distance training. They are made from flat-sheen, double-knit fabric and the chamois is Pactimo’s Endurance Anatomic Gem 2, a combination foam insert, which the brand claims is supportive and comfortable. 

They feature Pactimo’s Clip&Pit system comfort break design, which unclip at the chest strap and allow the rear panel to be pulled down. The bib shorts offer a gentle level of compression and have raw edge cut straps and leg openings, which makes them feel less secure, but are soft against the skin.

  • Read our full Pactimo Summit Classic bib shorts review 
  • Buy now from Pactimo

8. Assos UMA GTV Bib Shorts C2 

£215 | View offer

Highlights: Comfort break feature, Comfortable, Compressive, Decent short length, Flattering cut
Sizes available: XS – XXL Colours available: Black

The Assos UMA GTV bib shorts are high-performance, however they have a nature calls feature which uses detachable bib straps as opposed to just stretchy fabric. The design features two magnetic closures at the rear which can be undone without needing to remove upper layers.

The bib shorts are engineered for endurance riding and are made from OSSIDA, a 40-gauge, circular-knit fabric which provides compression and breathability, given these shorts a racy feel. 

The mesh panel across the stomach area allows riders to sit in an aggressive position while still maintaining comfort. The bib shorts are flattering, comfy and ideal for long rides.

  • Read our full Assos UMA GTV bib shorts review 

9. Le Col Women’s Sport Cargo bib shorts

£77.50 (RRP £155) | View offer

Highlights: Deep pockets, Price, Good breathability, Quality chamois
Sizes available: XS – XL Colours available: Black, black/White

The Le Col Women’s Sport Cargo bib shorts are designed for everyday riding, with ‘durable yet lightweight’ mesh pockets. The bib shorts feel lightweight thanks to the breathable mesh upper and straps and the main material is thin enough to help keep body temperature down but not so much as to feel cold or flimsy.

These are a training fit so are not very compressive and the grippers hold the leg fabric securely in place. The pockets are wonderfully deep and secure, and the chamois performs well on both longer and shorter rides. These shorts do not feature a comfort break option.

  • Read our Le Col Women’s Sport Cargo bib shorts review
  • Buy now from Le Col

10. Maap Women’s Pro Bib 2.0 bib shorts

£260 | View offer

Highlights: Compressive, Good environmental credentials, Racy, Comfortable, Great chamois
Sizes available: XXS – XL Colours available: Black, shiitake, navy

The Maap Women’s Pro Bib 2.0 are a great pair of bib shorts designed for hot weather, and offering a compressive fit. The shorts are made with a four-way 3D aero structure and stretch compression fabric and are ideal for those who like aggressive riding and feeling fast. They feature a comfortable 3D chamois which moulds to the body shape and doesn’t protrude massively.

The leg length is also good, with the shorts coming up just above the knee and the bib straps feel secure and well-made, with not an ounce of flimsiness. Noticeably, the bib shorts are made with a textured material that gives them a different look to others on the market.

  • Read our Maap Women’s Pro Bib 2.0 bib shorts review
  • Buy now from Maap

11. Universal Colours Mono women’s Bib Shorts

£65 (RRP £125) | View offer

Highlights: Comfort break feature, Comfortable, Use of recycled fabrics, Good length, Compressive
Sizes available: XXS – XXL Colours available: Black, navy blue, lawson gold, deep red, canopy green

Made from pre and post-consumer recycled fabrics, the Universal Colours Mono women’s bib shorts offer comfort, compression and strong sustainability credentials. 

The bib shorts are great for long distances, offering a neat comfort break solution, and a 13mm thick chamois made from perforated foam which gives a good level of breathability and shock absorption. They have 50+ UPF sun protection and subtle reflective logos.  

These are an excellent pair of shoes which are well priced, offering great value, high performance tech and are particularly good for tall riders as thanks to the decent short length. 

  • Read our full Universal Colours mono women’s bib shorts review
  • Buy now from Universal Colours

FAQ

What makes a good set of cycling bib shorts?

  • Comfort break feature – being able to pee without needing to remove all of your upper layers is useful for practicality, speed and safety. Brands use different methods to achieve this. For more information, see our guide to the best women’s comfort break cycling shorts.
  • Fit – dependent on preference, body shape and riding type, riders require a variety of different types of fit, whether that be regarding the specific cut or level of compression. It’s important to consider what you’re aiming to get out of your bib shorts. If you’re after speed, a compressive race cut will be key. If it’s comfort, looking for anatomic designs and mid-level compression may suit you better.
  • Chamois – as with fit, chamois’ will vary dependent on intended ride type. Long-distance chamois’ will often be denser or thicker, to provide additional support for long days in the saddle. Shorts aimed at shorter rides may offer a slimmer, less noticeable chamois which may suit those who are after a less obtrusive aesthetic.
  • Pockets – we love pockets here at Cyclist. IUnless you’re racing and after all the aero gains, bib short pockets are almost always useful for easier or extra storage for essentials like your phone, snacks etc.

Interested specifically in bib shorts that you allow you to pee while wearing? Read our guide to the best comfort break bib shorts.
